titleStmt.title: Samuel Coulter v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Samuel Coulter v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington Second Judicial District
In the matter of the application of Samuel Coulter for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon R.S. Greene Judge of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory

By law of said Judge therefore first obtained Samuel Coulter the Complaiant in this case makes this his amended complaint and alleges that he is restrained of his liberty by an order of arrest issued by the District Court of Pierce County in said Territory which said order is now in the hand of W.C. Hawks Deputy Sheriff of said County as Bailiff of said Court as this complainant is informed and believes. That the said W.C. Hawks is about to said complainant from said Second Judicial District of said Washington Territory and from Olympia where he now resides to Steilacoom in said Pierce County of said Territory.

Complainant alleges that said restraint and arrest are illegal and without authority of law, in this; that complainant is arrested by said Hawks for the purpose of compelling him to appear as a witness in a certain cause now preceding in the District Court of the Third Judicial District of said Territory now sitting at said Steilacoom in said County of Pierce. That said complainant has never been subpoenaed and required to appear in said Court as a Witness in any cause now preceding therein - that said complainant lives without the him its of the said Third Judicial District and that his residence is now there thirty miles from said Steilacoom in said County of Pierce where said Court is now held by all routes of travel thereto from his said residence. Complainant further says that he is the Collector of Internal Revenues of the United States for the District of Washington Territory, that his office and place of business is in Olympia in Thurston Co. W.T. and that his removal therefore would seriously interfere with the duties of his said office of Collector of Revenue as aforesaid, complainant says that he has been arrested on an Order of Attachment for failure to make to said Court sitting now at Steilacoom aforesaid. Certified copies of public records beloning to his said office which said order is alleged to be made by Hon O. Jacobs Judge of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of said Washington Territory now holding term at Steilacoom aforesaid. That said alleged order was not
